name: games
title: Google Play Game Services API
description: The API for Google Play Game Services.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

enum.name: json
enum.desc: Responses with Content-Type of application/json

schemas.name: RoomAutoMatchingCriteria
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a room auto-match criteria object.

fields.name: minAutoMatchingPlayers
fields.desc: The minimum number of players that should be added to the room by auto-matching.

fields.name: exclusiveBitmask
fields.desc: A bitmask indicating when auto-matches are valid. When ANDed with other exclusive bitmasks, the result must be zero. Can be used to support exclusive roles within a game.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomAutoMatchingCriteria.

fields.name: maxAutoMatchingPlayers
fields.desc: The maximum number of players that should be added to the room by auto-matching.

schemas.name: RoomClientAddress
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for the client address when setting up a room.

fields.name: xmppAddress
fields.desc: The XMPP address of the client on the Google Games XMPP network.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomClientAddress.

schemas.name: TurnBasedAutoMatchingCriteria
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for an turn-based auto-match criteria object.

fields.name: maxAutoMatchingPlayers
fields.desc: The maximum number of players that should be added to the match by auto-matching.

fields.name: minAutoMatchingPlayers
fields.desc: The minimum number of players that should be added to the match by auto-matching.

fields.name: exclusiveBitmask
fields.desc: A bitmask indicating when auto-matches are valid. When ANDed with other exclusive bitmasks, the result must be zero. Can be used to support exclusive roles within a game.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedAutoMatchingCriteria.

schemas.name: ApplicationCategory
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for an application category object.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#applicationCategory.

fields.name: primary
fields.desc: The primary category.

fields.name: secondary
fields.desc: The secondary category.

schemas.name: InstanceWebDetails
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for the Web details resource.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#instanceWebDetails.

fields.name: launchUrl
fields.desc: Launch URL for the game.

fields.name: preferred
fields.desc: Indicates that this instance is the default for new installations.

schemas.name: PlayerScoreListResponse
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a list of score submission statuses.

fields.name: submittedScores
fields.desc: The score submissions statuses.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerScoreListResponse.

schemas.name: Quest
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a Quest resource.

fields.name: bannerUrl
fields.desc: The banner image URL for the quest.

fields.name: endTimestampMillis
fields.desc: The timestamp at which the quest ceases to be active in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC.

fields.name: lastUpdatedTimestampMillis
fields.desc: The timestamp at which the quest was last updated by the user in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC. Only present if the player has accepted the quest.

fields.name: notifyTimestampMillis
fields.desc: The timestamp at which the user should be notified that the quest will end soon in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC.

fields.name: startTimestampMillis
fields.desc: The timestamp at which the quest becomes active in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC.

fields.name: acceptedTimestampMillis
fields.desc: The timestamp at which the user accepted the quest in milliseconds since the epoch in UTC. Only present if the player has accepted the quest.

fields.name: iconUrl
fields.desc: The icon image URL for the quest.

fields.name: milestones
fields.desc: The quest milestones.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the quest.

fields.name: applicationId
fields.desc: The ID of the application this quest is part of.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: The description of the quest.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The ID of the quest.

fields.name: isDefaultBannerUrl
fields.desc: Indicates whether the banner image being returned is a default image, or is game-provided.

fields.name: isDefaultIconUrl
fields.desc: Indicates whether the icon image being returned is a default image, or is game-provided.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#quest.

fields.name: state
fields.desc:
The state of the quest.
Possible values are:  
- "UPCOMING": The quest is upcoming. The user can see the quest, but cannot accept it until it is open. 
- "OPEN": The quest is currently open and may be accepted at this time. 
- "ACCEPTED": The user is currently participating in this quest. 
- "COMPLETED": The user has completed the quest. 
- "FAILED": The quest was attempted but was not completed before the deadline expired. 
- "EXPIRED": The quest has expired and was not accepted. 
- "DELETED": The quest should be deleted from the local database.

schemas.name: RoomAutoMatchStatus
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for status of room automatching that is in progress.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomAutoMatchStatus.

fields.name: waitEstimateSeconds
fields.desc: An estimate for the amount of time (in seconds) that auto-matching is expected to take to complete.

schemas.name: RoomCreateRequest
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a room creation request.

fields.name: variant
fields.desc: The variant / mode of the application to be played. This can be any integer value, or left blank. You should use a small number of variants to keep the auto-matching pool as large as possible.

fields.name: autoMatchingCriteria
fields.desc: Criteria for auto-matching players into this room.

fields.name: capabilities
fields.desc: The capabilities that this client supports for realtime communication.

fields.name: clientAddress
fields.desc: Client address for the player creating the room.

fields.name: invitedPlayerIds
fields.desc: The player IDs to invite to the room.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomCreateRequest.

fields.name: networkDiagnostics
fields.desc: Network diagnostics for the client creating the room.

fields.name: requestId
fields.desc: A randomly generated numeric ID. This number is used at the server to ensure that the request is handled correctly across retries.

schemas.name: TurnBasedMatchSync
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a list of turn-based matches returned from a sync.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchSync.

fields.name: moreAvailable
fields.desc: True if there were more matches available to fetch at the time the response was generated (which were not returned due to page size limits.)

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: The pagination token for the next page of results.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: The matches.

schemas.name: EventPeriodRange
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for an event period time range.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventPeriodRange.

fields.name: periodEndMillis
fields.desc: The time when this update period ends, in millis, since 1970 UTC (Unix Epoch).

fields.name: periodStartMillis
fields.desc: The time when this update period begins, in millis, since 1970 UTC (Unix Epoch).

schemas.name: PlayerEvent
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for an event status resource.

fields.name: definitionId
fields.desc: The ID of the event definition.

fields.name: formattedNumEvents
fields.desc: The current number of times this event has occurred, as a string. The formatting of this string depends on the configuration of your event in the Play Games Developer Console.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerEvent.

fields.name: numEvents
fields.desc: The current number of times this event has occurred.

fields.name: playerId
fields.desc: The ID of the player.

schemas.name: QuestListResponse
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a list of quest objects.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: The quests.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#questListResponse.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: Token corresponding to the next page of results.

schemas.name: RevisionCheckResponse
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for the result of checking a revision.

fields.name: revisionStatus
fields.desc:
The result of the revision check.
Possible values are:  
- "OK" - The revision being used is current. 
- "DEPRECATED" - There is currently a newer version available, but the revision being used still works. 
- "INVALID" - The revision being used is not supported in any released version.

fields.name: apiVersion
fields.desc: The version of the API this client revision should use when calling API methods.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#revisionCheckResponse.

schemas.name: TurnBasedMatchData
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a turn-based match data object.

fields.name: data
fields.desc: The byte representation of the data (limited to 128 kB), as a Base64-encoded string with the URL_SAFE encoding option.

fields.name: dataAvailable
fields.desc: True if this match has data available but it wasn't returned in a list response; fetching the match individually will retrieve this data.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchData.

schemas.name: TurnBasedMatchParticipant
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a participant in a turn-based match.

fields.name: autoMatched
fields.desc: True if this participant was auto-matched with the requesting player.

fields.name: autoMatchedPlayer
fields.desc: Information about a player that has been anonymously auto-matched against the requesting player. (Either player or autoMatchedPlayer will be set.)

fields.name: id
fields.desc: An identifier for the participant in the scope of the match. Cannot be used to identify a player across matches or in other contexts.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchParticipant.

fields.name: player
fields.desc: Information about the player. Not populated if this player was anonymously auto-matched against the requesting player. (Either player or autoMatchedPlayer will be set.)

fields.name: status
fields.desc:
The status of the participant with respect to the match.
Possible values are:  
- "PARTICIPANT_NOT_INVITED_YET" - The participant is slated to be invited to the match, but the invitation has not been sent; the invite will be sent when it becomes their turn. 
- "PARTICIPANT_INVITED" - The participant has been invited to join the match, but has not yet responded. 
- "PARTICIPANT_JOINED" - The participant has joined the match (either after creating it or accepting an invitation.) 
- "PARTICIPANT_DECLINED" - The participant declined an invitation to join the match. 
- "PARTICIPANT_LEFT" - The participant joined the match and then left it. 
- "PARTICIPANT_FINISHED" - The participant finished playing in the match. 
- "PARTICIPANT_UNRESPONSIVE" - The participant did not take their turn in the allotted time.

schemas.name: AchievementUpdateRequest
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a request to update an achievement.

fields.name: updateType
fields.desc:
The type of update being applied.
Possible values are:  
- "REVEAL" - Achievement is revealed. 
- "UNLOCK" - Achievement is unlocked. 
- "INCREMENT" - Achievement is incremented. 
- "SET_STEPS_AT_LEAST" - Achievement progress is set to at least the passed value.

fields.name: achievementId
fields.desc: The achievement this update is being applied to.

fields.name: incrementPayload
fields.desc: The payload if an update of type INCREMENT was requested for the achievement.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementUpdateRequest.

fields.name: setStepsAtLeastPayload
fields.desc: The payload if an update of type SET_STEPS_AT_LEAST was requested for the achievement.

fields.name: requestId

fields.name: timePeriods

fields.name: currentState

The current state of the achievement.

fields.name: currentSteps

fields.name: webInstance

fields.name: acquisitionUri

fields.name: androidInstance

fields.name: timeSpan

The time span for this player score.
Possible values are:  
- "ALL_TIME" - The score is an all-time score. 
- "WEEKLY" - The score is a weekly score. 
- "DAILY" - The score is a daily score.

fields.name: invitedPlayerIds

fields.name: kind

fields.name: variant

schemas.name: AchievementSetStepsAtLeastResponse

fields.name: kind

fields.name: newlyUnlocked

schemas.name: AnonymousPlayer

fields.name: displayName
fields.desc: The name to display for the anonymous player.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#anonymousPlayer.

schemas.name: EventBatchRecordFailure
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a batch update failure resource.

fields.name: failureCause
fields.desc:
The cause for the update failure.
Possible values are:  
- "TOO_LARGE": A batch request was issued with more events than are allowed in a single batch. 
- "TIME_PERIOD_EXPIRED": A batch was sent with data too far in the past to record. 
- "TIME_PERIOD_SHORT": A batch was sent with a time range that was too short. 
- "TIME_PERIOD_LONG": A batch was sent with a time range that was too long. 
- "ALREADY_UPDATED": An attempt was made to record a batch of data which was already seen. 
- "RECORD_RATE_HIGH": An attempt was made to record data faster than the server will apply updates.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#eventBatchRecordFailure.

fields.name: range
fields.desc: The time range which was rejected; empty for a request-wide failure.

schemas.name: ParticipantResult
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a result for a match participant.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#participantResult.

fields.name: participantId
fields.desc: The ID of the participant.

fields.name: placing
fields.desc: The placement or ranking of the participant in the match results; a number from one to the number of participants in the match. Multiple participants may have the same placing value in case of a type.

fields.name: result
fields.desc:
The result of the participant for this match.
Possible values are:  
- "MATCH_RESULT_WIN" - The participant won the match. 
- "MATCH_RESULT_LOSS" - The participant lost the match. 
- "MATCH_RESULT_TIE" - The participant tied the match. 
- "MATCH_RESULT_NONE" - There was no winner for the match (nobody wins or loses this kind of game.) 
- "MATCH_RESULT_DISCONNECT" - The participant disconnected / left during the match. 
- "MATCH_RESULT_DISAGREED" - Different clients reported different results for this participant.

schemas.name: PlayerAchievement
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for an achievement object.

fields.name: lastUpdatedTimestamp
fields.desc: The timestamp of the last modification to this achievement's state.

fields.name: achievementState
fields.desc:
The state of the achievement.
Possible values are:  
- "HIDDEN" - Achievement is hidden. 
- "REVEALED" - Achievement is revealed. 
- "UNLOCKED" - Achievement is unlocked.

fields.name: currentSteps
fields.desc: The current steps for an incremental achievement.

fields.name: experiencePoints
fields.desc: Experience points earned for the achievement. This field is absent for achievements that have not yet been unlocked and 0 for achievements that have been unlocked by testers but that are unpublished.

fields.name: formattedCurrentStepsString
fields.desc: The current steps for an incremental achievement as a string.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The ID of the achievement.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#playerAchievement.

schemas.name: QuestContribution
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a Quest Criterion Contribution resource.

fields.name: formattedValue
fields.desc: The formatted value of the contribution as a string. Format depends on the configuration for the associated event definition in the Play Games Developer Console.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#questContribution.

fields.name: value
fields.desc: The value of the contribution.

schemas.name: Room
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a room resource object.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#room.

fields.name: participants
fields.desc: The participants involved in the room, along with their statuses. Includes participants who have left or declined invitations.

fields.name: roomStatusVersion
fields.desc: The version of the room status: an increasing counter, used by the client to ignore out-of-order updates to room status.

fields.name: variant
fields.desc: The variant / mode of the application being played; can be any integer value, or left blank.

fields.name: autoMatchingCriteria
fields.desc: Criteria for auto-matching players into this room.

fields.name: autoMatchingStatus
fields.desc: Auto-matching status for this room. Not set if the room is not currently in the auto-matching queue.

fields.name: creationDetails
fields.desc: Details about the room creation.

fields.name: inviterId
fields.desc: The ID of the participant that invited the user to the room. Not set if the user was not invited to the room.

fields.name: status
fields.desc:
The status of the room.
Possible values are:  
- "ROOM_INVITING" - One or more players have been invited and not responded. 
- "ROOM_AUTO_MATCHING" - One or more slots need to be filled by auto-matching. 
- "ROOM_CONNECTING" - Players have joined and are connecting to each other (either before or after auto-matching). 
- "ROOM_ACTIVE" - All players have joined and connected to each other. 
- "ROOM_DELETED" - The room should no longer be shown on the client. Returned in sync calls when a player joins a room (as a tombstone), or for rooms where all joined participants have left.

fields.name: applicationId
fields.desc: The ID of the application being played.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: This short description is generated by our servers and worded relative to the player requesting the room. It is intended to be displayed when the room is shown in a list (that is, an invitation to a room.)

fields.name: lastUpdateDetails
fields.desc: Details about the last update to the room.

fields.name: roomId
fields.desc: Globally unique ID for a room.

schemas.name: SnapshotImage
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for an image of a snapshot.

fields.name: height
fields.desc: The height of the image.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#snapshotImage.

fields.name: mime_type
fields.desc: The MIME type of the image.

fields.name: url
fields.desc: The URL of the image. This URL may be invalidated at any time and should not be cached.

fields.name: width
fields.desc: The width of the image.

schemas.name: AchievementDefinition
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for an achievement definition object.

fields.name: isRevealedIconUrlDefault
fields.desc: Indicates whether the revealed icon image being returned is a default image, or is provided by the game.

fields.name: isUnlockedIconUrlDefault
fields.desc: Indicates whether the unlocked icon image being returned is a default image, or is game-provided.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#achievementDefinition.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the achievement.

fields.name: revealedIconUrl
fields.desc: The image URL for the revealed achievement icon.

fields.name: achievementType
fields.desc:

schemas.name: RoomStatus
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for the status of a room that the player has joined.

fields.name: status
fields.desc:
The status of the room.
Possible values are:  
- "ROOM_INVITING" - One or more players have been invited and not responded. 
- "ROOM_AUTO_MATCHING" - One or more slots need to be filled by auto-matching. 
- "ROOM_CONNECTING" - Players have joined are connecting to each other (either before or after auto-matching). 
- "ROOM_ACTIVE" - All players have joined and connected to each other. 
- "ROOM_DELETED" - All joined players have left.

fields.name: statusVersion
fields.desc: The version of the status for the room: an increasing counter, used by the client to ignore out-of-order updates to room status.

fields.name: autoMatchingStatus
fields.desc: Auto-matching status for this room. Not set if the room is not currently in the automatching queue.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomStatus.

fields.name: participants
fields.desc: The participants involved in the room, along with their statuses. Includes participants who have left or declined invitations.

fields.name: roomId
fields.desc: Globally unique ID for a room.

fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatchTurn.

fields.name: matchVersion
fields.desc: The version of this match: an increasing counter, used to avoid out-of-date updates to the match.

fields.name: pendingParticipantId
fields.desc: The ID of the participant who should take their turn next. May be set to the current player's participant ID to update match state without changing the turn. If not set, the match will wait for other player(s) to join via automatching; this is only valid if automatch criteria is set on the match with remaining slots for automatched players.

fields.name: results
fields.desc: The match results for the participants in the match.

schemas.name: QuestCriterion
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a Quest Criterion resource.

fields.name: currentContribution
fields.desc:
The number of increments the player has made toward the completion count event increments required to complete the quest. This value will not exceed the completion contribution.
There will be no currentContribution until the player has accepted the quest.

fields.name: eventId
fields.desc: The ID of the event the criterion corresponds to.

fields.name: initialPlayerProgress
fields.desc:
The value of the event associated with this quest at the time that the quest was accepted. This value may change if event increments that took place before the start of quest are uploaded after the quest starts.
There will be no initialPlayerProgress until the player has accepted the quest.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#questCriterion.

fields.name: completionContribution
fields.desc: The total number of times the associated event must be incremented for the player to complete this quest.

fields.desc:
The current state of the milestone.
Possible values are:  
- "COMPLETED_NOT_CLAIMED" - The milestone is complete, but has not yet been claimed. 
- "CLAIMED" - The milestone is complete and has been claimed. 
- "NOT_COMPLETED" - The milestone has not yet been completed. 
- "NOT_STARTED" - The milestone is for a quest that has not yet been accepted.

fields.name: completionRewardData
fields.desc: The completion reward data of the milestone, represented as a Base64-encoded string. This is a developer-specified binary blob with size between 0 and 2 KB before encoding.

fields.name: criteria

The error code in event of a failure.
Possible values are:  
- "P2P_FAILED" - The client failed to establish a P2P connection with the peer. 
- "PRESENCE_FAILED" - The client failed to register to receive P2P connections. 
- "RELAY_SERVER_FAILED" - The client received an error when trying to use the relay server to establish a P2P connection with the peer.

The status of the peer in the room.
Possible values are:  
- "CONNECTION_ESTABLISHED" - The client established a P2P connection with the peer. 
- "CONNECTION_FAILED" - The client failed to establish directed presence with the peer.

fields.name: unreliableRoundtripLatencyMillis
fields.desc: The amount of time in milliseconds it took to send packets back and forth on the unreliable channel with this peer.

fields.name: connectionSetupLatencyMillis
fields.desc: The amount of time in milliseconds it took to establish connections with this peer.

schemas.name: RoomParticipant
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a participant in a room.

fields.name: autoMatchedPlayer
fields.desc: Information about a player that has been anonymously auto-matched against the requesting player. (Either player or autoMatchedPlayer will be set.)

fields.name: capabilities
fields.desc: The capabilities which can be used when communicating with this participant.

fields.name: clientAddress
fields.desc: Client address for the participant.

fields.name: player
fields.desc: Information about the player. Not populated if this player was anonymously auto-matched against the requesting player. (Either player or autoMatchedPlayer will be set.)

fields.name: leaveReason
fields.desc:
The reason the participant left the room; populated if the participant status is PARTICIPANT_LEFT.
Possible values are:  
- "PLAYER_LEFT" - The player explicitly chose to leave the room. 
- "GAME_LEFT" - The game chose to remove the player from the room. 
- "ABANDONED" - The player switched to another application and abandoned the room.
- "PEER_CONNECTION_FAILURE" - The client was unable to establish or maintain a connection to other peer(s) in the room.
- "SERVER_ERROR" - The client received an error response when it tried to communicate with the server. 
- "TIMEOUT" - The client timed out while waiting for players to join and connect. 
- "PRESENCE_FAILURE" - The client's XMPP connection ended abruptly.

fields.name: status
fields.desc:
The status of the participant with respect to the room.
Possible values are:  
- "PARTICIPANT_INVITED" - The participant has been invited to join the room, but has not yet responded. 
- "PARTICIPANT_JOINED" - The participant has joined the room (either after creating it or accepting an invitation.) 
- "PARTICIPANT_DECLINED" - The participant declined an invitation to join the room. 
- "PARTICIPANT_LEFT" - The participant joined the room and then left it.

fields.name: autoMatched
fields.desc: True if this participant was auto-matched with the requesting player.

fields.name: connected
fields.desc: True if this participant is in the fully connected set of peers in the room.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: An identifier for the participant in the scope of the room. Cannot be used to identify a player across rooms or in other contexts.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomParticipant.

schemas.name: RoomLeaveRequest
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a leave room request.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#roomLeaveRequest.

fields.name: leaveDiagnostics
fields.desc: Diagnostics for a player leaving the room.

fields.name: reason
fields.desc:
Reason for leaving the match.
Possible values are:  
- "PLAYER_LEFT" - The player chose to leave the room.. 
- "GAME_LEFT" - The game chose to remove the player from the room. 
- "REALTIME_ABANDONED" - The player switched to another application and abandoned the room. 
- "REALTIME_PEER_CONNECTION_FAILURE" - The client was unable to establish a connection to other peer(s). 
- "REALTIME_SERVER_CONNECTION_FAILURE" - The client was unable to communicate with the server. 
- "REALTIME_SERVER_ERROR" - The client received an error response when it tried to communicate with the server. 
- "REALTIME_TIMEOUT" - The client timed out while waiting for a room. 
- "REALTIME_CLIENT_DISCONNECTING" - The client disconnects without first calling Leave. 
- "REALTIME_SIGN_OUT" - The user signed out of G+ while in the room. 
- "REALTIME_GAME_CRASHED" - The game crashed. 
- "REALTIME_ROOM_SERVICE_CRASHED" - RoomAndroidService crashed. 
- "REALTIME_DIFFERENT_CLIENT_ROOM_OPERATION" - Another client is trying to enter a room. 
- "REALTIME_SAME_CLIENT_ROOM_OPERATION" - The same client is trying to enter a new room.

schemas.name: TurnBasedMatch
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a turn-based match resource object.

fields.name: autoMatchingCriteria
fields.desc: Criteria for auto-matching players into this match.

fields.name: data
fields.desc: The data / game state for this match.

fields.name: participants
fields.desc: The participants involved in the match, along with their statuses. Includes participants who have left or declined invitations.

fields.name: previousMatchData
fields.desc: The data / game state for the previous match; set for the first turn of rematches only.

fields.name: pendingParticipantId
fields.desc: The ID of the participant that is taking a turn.

fields.name: variant
fields.desc: The variant / mode of the application being played; can be any integer value, or left blank.

fields.name: applicationId
fields.desc: The ID of the application being played.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string games#turnBasedMatch.

fields.name: lastUpdateDetails
fields.desc: Details about the last update to the match.

fields.name: matchNumber
fields.desc: The number of the match in a chain of rematches. Will be set to 1 for the first match and incremented by 1 for each rematch.

fields.name: results
fields.desc: The results reported for this match.

fields.name: userMatchStatus
fields.desc:
The status of the current user in the match. Derived from the match type, match status, the user's participant status, and the pending participant for the match.
Possible values are:  
- "USER_INVITED" - The user has been invited to join the match and has not responded yet. 
- "USER_AWAITING_TURN" - The user is waiting for their turn. 
- "USER_TURN" - The user has an action to take in the match. 
- "USER_MATCH_COMPLETED" - The match has ended (it is completed, canceled, or expired.)

fields.name: description
fields.desc: This short description is generated by our servers based on turn state and is localized and worded relative to the player requesting the match. It is intended to be displayed when the match is shown in a list.

fields.name: inviterId
fields.desc: The ID of the participant that invited the user to the match. Not set if the user was not invited to the match.

fields.name: matchVersion
fields.desc: The version of this match: an increasing counter, used to avoid out-of-date updates to the match.

fields.name: rematchId
fields.desc: The ID of a rematch of this match. Only set for completed matches that have been rematched.

fields.name: creationDetails
fields.desc: Details about the match creation.

fields.name: matchId
fields.desc: Globally unique ID for a turn-based match.

fields.name: status
fields.desc:
The status of the match.
Possible values are:  
- "MATCH_AUTO_MATCHING" - One or more slots need to be filled by auto-matching; the match cannot be established until they are filled. 
- "MATCH_ACTIVE" - The match has started. 
- "MATCH_COMPLETE" - The match has finished. 
- "MATCH_CANCELED" - The match was canceled. 
- "MATCH_EXPIRED" - The match expired due to inactivity. 
- "MATCH_DELETED" - The match should no longer be shown on the client. Returned only for tombstones for matches when sync is called.

fields.name: withParticipantId
fields.desc: The ID of another participant in the match that can be used when describing the participants the user is playing with.

methods.name: get
methods.desc:
Get high scores, and optionally ranks, in leaderboards for the currently authenticated player. For a specific time span, leaderboardId can be set to ALL to retrieve data for all leaderboards in a given time span.
NOTE: You cannot ask for 'ALL' leaderboards and 'ALL' timeSpans in the same request; only one parameter may be set to 'ALL'.

pathParams.name: playerId
pathParams.desc: A player ID. A value of me may be used in place of the authenticated player's ID.

pathParams.name: leaderboardId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the leaderboard. Can be set to 'ALL' to retrieve data for all leaderboards for this application.

pathParams.name: timeSpan
pathParams.desc: The time span for the scores and ranks you're requesting.

enum.name: ALL
enum.desc: Get the high scores for all time spans. If this is used, maxResults values will be ignored.

enum.name: ALL_TIME
enum.desc: Get the all time high score.

enum.name: DAILY
enum.desc: List the top scores for the current day.

enum.name: WEEKLY
